It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pleroma hatschbachii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
